definitions: a description of an important plot development in a television show, movie, or book which if previously known may reduce surprise or suspense for a first-time viewer or reader.
shortDefinitions: description of important plot development in television programme etc.

definitions: a news story published to divert attention from and reduce the impact of a similar item published elsewhere
shortDefinitions: news story published to divert attention from item published elsewhere

definitions: a person or thing that spoils something

examples.text: it is a sad thing that so many so-called book lovers are book spoilers

shortDefinitions: person or thing that spoils something

definitions: (especially in a political context) a person who obstructs or prevents an opponent's success while having no chance of winning a contest themselves

examples.text: he is perceived as a genuine factor in the presidential election, a certified political spoiler

shortDefinitions: person who obstructs or prevents opponent's success

definitions: a flap on the wing of an aircraft that can be projected in order to create drag and so reduce speed.
shortDefinitions: flap on wing of aircraft that can be projected

definitions: a device on the front or rear of a motor vehicle intended to prevent it from being lifted off the road when traveling at very high speeds.
shortDefinitions: structure on motor vehicle intended to improve roadholding

definitions: an electronic device for preventing unauthorized copying of sound recordings by means of a disruptive signal inaudible on the original.
shortDefinitions: electronic device for preventing unauthorized copying of sound recordings
